name: Kuromitsu
description: Kuromitsu (黒蜜) is a delicious dark brown syrup made with kurozato, an unrefined black sugar from Okinawa. Use my easy recipe to make this mineral-rich sweetener at home and drizzle it on your favorite Japanese desserts.
recipeIngredient: 3.5 oz black sugar ((kurozato 黒砂糖 or Kokuto 黒糖))

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, mix 3.5 oz black sugar, ½ cup sugar (to taste), and ½ cup water. Bring it to a boil over medium heat. Tip: This kuromitsu is quite rich, so feel free to reduce the amount of granulated sugar or omit it entirely, to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small saucepan, mix 3.5 oz black sugar, ½ cup sugar (to taste), and ½ cup water. Bring it to a boil over medium heat. Tip: This kuromitsu is quite rich, so feel free to reduce the amount of granulated sugar or omit it entirely, to your preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15–20 minutes, stirring gently until the sugar dissolves completely and the mixture thickens slightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow it to cool and transfer to an air tight jar/bottle. Keep in the refrigerator up to a week.
